info.name: Qiy Node
info.description: This document describes the DigitalMe Qiy Node API: the API of the Qiy Node as implemented by DigitalMe. DigitalMe endorses the principles of the [Qiy Foundation][Qiy Foundation] and the implementation will comply fully with the [Specifications of the Qiy Scheme](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/Qiy-Scheme-v1.1/Qiy%20Guide.md). Any differences will be provided in this description. A [Qiy Node][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Qiy Node] is a [Node][ Archimate Node] that hosts a single [Technology Service][ Archimate Technology Service] which enables a single [Individual][ Qiy Scheme 4 1 Qiy Users] to reuse his data at a Data Provider with a Relying Party as elaborated in the [High-Level Architectural Overview](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/Qiy-Scheme-v1.1/High-Level%20Architectural%20Overview.md#21-data-reuse): 1. The Individual chooses and launches an [End User App][API Basics Documentation End User App] which is based on the Qiy Trust Principles. 2. The Individual uses the app to link with a Data Provider. 3. A [Relying Party asks an Individual for a (data) feed to access his data][Feeds Relying Party Request for feed]. 4. The [Individual uses the app to consider the request][Feeds Individual User Action Message Event] and [set the Data Provider as source for the feed][Feeds Individual Set feed]. 5. The [Relying Party receives a feed][Feeds Relying Party Data Reference Received-v2 Callback] and [uses it][Feeds Relying Party Access feed] to access the data. item.name: Registration
item.description:
[Service Providers][API Basics Documentation Service Provider] and [Application Providers][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy Trust Network Application Provider] can register with an [Access Provider][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy Trust Network Access Provider]:
1. both receive an [API Key][API Basics Authentication App Authentication]
2. Service Providers can whitelist [endpoints][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints] and receive a [Qiy Node Credential][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Qiy Node Qiy Node Credential].

item.name: Service Desk
item.description:
Please contact the Service Desk for your requests. The Service Desk is available during regular CEST office hours and can be contacted by e-mail or phone:
* service@digital-me.nl
* +31 (0) 411-616565

item.name: Versions
item.description:
This api is versioned using [Semantic Versioning 2.0.0](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html) and follows this specification. In addition, the following rules apply:
* [DigitalMe](https://digital-me.nl/) supports two major versions in the production environment: one primary version and one secondary version.
* [DigitalMe](https://digital-me.nl/) will support a secondary version for at least 6 months.
* [DigitalMe](https://digital-me.nl/) supports one development version in a development environment.
* A development version may change at any time.

The current version of the api is returned by [Get /api][API Get Api].

[API Get Api]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#27416893-7da4-411f-8847-88103d17dc86

item.name: App Authentication
item.description:
In the next version, Qiy Applications are required to authenticate requests using an API Key implemented using basic authentication.

An e-mail address provided by the application provider will be used to maintain the API Keys.
Please use this e-mail address to e-mail the [Service Desk][API Basics Service Desk] your API Key request.

[API Basics Service Desk]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#9060bf32-11d2-4736-add3-629b52491c70

item.name: User Authentication
Bash
item.description:
The authorization header parameter can be generated with this Bass script:

```
#!/usr/bin/env bash

set -eu

#########################
# Test input to make things reproducable
#########################
UUID="bd89bab6-9d28-48ae-ba90-c3ed6472f502"
NONCE="1497006092128"
INPUT=""

#########################
# Cacluate the actual signature
#########################
authHeader() {
	local -r NONCE=$(date +%s%3N)
	local -r TOSIGN="${UUID}${NONCE}${1:-}"
    local -r SIG=$(printf "%s" "${TOSIGN}" | openssl dgst -sha256 -sign ${UUID}_private.pem | base64 -w0)
    AUTH_HEADER="QTF ${UUID} ${NONCE}:${SIG}"
}

#########################
# Convert private key to PEM
#########################
genPem() {
	local -r dashes="-----"
	local -r private_key='<MAKE SURE TO REPLACE THIS TEXT WITH THE PRIVATE KEY BEFORE USING THIS SCRIPT>'
	printf "%sBEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY%s\n%s\n%sEND RSA PRIVATE KEY%s\n" "${dashes}" "${dashes}" "${private_key}" "${dashes}" "${dashes}" > ${UUID}_private.pem
}





#########################
# Do actual work
#########################
genPem
authHeader "${INPUT}"
echo -e "Given \n  input = [${INPUT}], \n  nonce = [${NONCE}] and \n  ID    = [${UUID}] \nWhen I calculate the Authorization header\nThen the value should be: \n  [${AUTH_HEADER}]"

```

All requests but the [request to create a Qiy Node][Nodes Request creation of Qiy Node] and the [Api Request][API] MUST be user authenticated using a signed token that can only be calculated using a [Qiy Node Credential][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Qiy Node Qiy Node Credential].

The token can be passed in the 'Authorization'-header parameter, but MUST be passed in the 'Authorization-node-QTN'-header parameter when App Authentication is used.


## Python

In Python, the authorization header parameter can be calculated with the package 'pyOpenSSL'.
Using a pem-file with the primary key of the Qiy Node it can be generated as follows:

```
from OpenSSL.crypto import sign
from base64 import b64encode
import OpenSSL

def authHeader(qiy_node_id, unix_time_in_msecs, body):
        tosign="{0}{1}{2}".format(qiy_node_id, unix_time_in_msecs, body)
        print("tosign: '{0}'".format(tosign))
        with open(<File with private key in pem format>,"r") as f:
                buffer=f.read()
        key=OpenSSL.crypto.load_privatekey(OpenSSL.crypto.FILETYPE_PEM,buffer)
        signature=b64encode(sign(
                key
                ,tosign
                ,"sha256")
                ).decode()
        return "QTF {0} {1}:{2}".format(qiy_node_id, unix_time_in_msecs, signature)
```

item.name: Password Header Parameter
item.description: Some request have a mandatory 'password'-header parameter, because they use the Transport Layer which requires authentication with a Transport Password.

item.name: Dynamic Endpoint Addresses
Action Messages List Endpoint
item.description:
This endpoint can be used to list action messages.
The current address of the endpoint is returned in the "amList"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].

[Nodes Get endpoint addresses]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#0bdb3ea3-0e8c-4f6d-8a92-8230d1be9a02

item.name: Connect Token Create Endpoint
item.description:
This endpoint can be used to [request][Connections Relying Party/Data Provider Request connect token] or [register][Connections Relying Party/Data Provider Register connect token] [Connect Tokens][Connections].
The current address of the endpoint is returned in the "ctCreate"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].

item.name: Connect Token List Endpoint
item.description:
This endpoint can be used to [list][Connections List connections] [Connect Tokens][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connect Tokens].
The current address of the endpoint is returned in the "ctList"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].

item.name: Connection Create Endpoint
item.description:
The Connection Create Endpoint can be used to [create a connection][Connections Individual Request connection].
The current address of the endpoint is returned in the "scan"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].

item.name: Connection Endpoint
item.description:
This endpoint can be used to [get the details of a connection][Connections Get connection].
The endpoint urls are returned by [Request connection][Connections Individual Request connection] and [List connections][Connections List connections].

item.name: Connection Feeds Endpoint
item.description:
This endpoint can be used by a Relying Party to request for a [feed](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#da1fbe7f-e134-4b94-94be-f1627696b4d5).

The current address of the endpoint is returned in a "feeds"-endpoint of a [connection](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#1778d5ca-9420-4ae3-826e-9a8a729b5475).

item.name: Connections List Endpoint
item.description:
The Connections List Endpoint can be used to [list connections][Connections List connections].
The current address of the endpoint is returned in the "ctList"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].

item.name: Events Endpoint
item.description:
The Events Endpoint can be used to [receive events][Nodes Start listening to events].
The current address of the endpoint is returned in the "events"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].

item.name: Event Callbacks Endpoint
item.description:
This Endpoint can be used to [set][Nodes Set event callback endpoints] or [get the addresses of the Event Callback endpoints][Nodes Get event callback endpoints].
The current address of the endpoint is returned in the "eventCallbacks"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].

item.name: Feeds Endpoint
item.description:
A [Relying Party][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider Relying Party] uses this endpoint to [list][Feeds Relying Party List feed ids] or access [one][Feeds Relying Party Access feed] or [more][Feeds Relying Party Access feeds] [feeds][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds] of an [Individual][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Individual] (connection) or of himself (a Qiy Node).

The address of the endpoint for a connection is returned in the "feeds"-member of the response of [List connections][Connections List connections] and/or [Get connection][Connections Get connection].
The address of the endpoint for a Qiy Node is returned in the "feeds"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].

item.name: Mailbox Endpoint
item.description:
This endpoint can be used to [send][Messages Send message] and [receive][Messages List messages] [messages][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Messages].
The current address of the endpoint is returned in a "mbox"-member of the response of [List connections][Connections List connections] or [Get connection][Connections Get connection].

item.name: Node Create Endpoint
item.description:
This endpoint can be used to [request the creation of a Qiy Node][Nodes Request creation of Qiy Node].
The current address of the endpoint is returned by [Get /api][API Get Api].

item.name: Node Settings Endpoint
item.description:
This endpoint can be used to [get][Nodes Get node settings] and [set][Nodes Set node settings] [settings of a Qiy Node][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Qiy Node Settings].
The current address of the endpoint is returned in the "nodeSettings"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses]

item.name: Reference Endpoint
item.description:
This endpoint can be used to tbd.
The current address of the endpoint is returned in the "ref"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].

item.name: References Endpoint
item.description:
This endpoint is deprecated.
The current address of the endpoint is returned in the "refs"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].

item.name: Self Endpoint
item.description:
This endpoint can be used to [delete a Qiy Node][Nodes Delete Qiy Node].
The endpoint address is returned in the 'self'-property of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].

item.name: Service Catalogue Endpoint
item.description:
This endpoint can be used to [get][Services Get service catalogue] or [set][Services Set service catalogue] the contents of a [Service Catalogue][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Service Catalogue].
The current address of the endpoint is returned in the "serviceCatalog"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].

The Qiy Node Api uses dynamic endpoint addresses most of which can be obtained using [GET /api][API Get api] and [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses].
The addresses can be cached, but should be refreshed every day.

[API Get Api]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#27416893-7da4-411f-8847-88103d17dc86
[Nodes Get endpoint addresses]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#0bdb3ea3-0e8c-4f6d-8a92-8230d1be9a02

item.name: Servers
Mock Server

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.value: Cache-Control, Pragma, Origin, Authorization, Content-Type, X-Requested-With, Set-Cookie, Cookie, Accept, password
header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Headers
header.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Access-Control-Expose-Headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

header.name: tracker
header.description: Custom header

request.description:
This call can be used to get the addresses of the [event callback endpoints][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Event Callback Endpoints].

exec: // Use '//Dynamic Endpoint Addresses/Get Api' to the eventsEndpointUrl.

header.value: Mock Start listening to events - ping

request.description:
This [Events Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Events Endpoint]-call can be used to start listening to [Qiy Node events][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Events].

It starts a long-living session with a heartbeat to keep the response open. 
Every 10 seconds a 'ping' comment will be sent. If this is not received for more than that time, something has gone wrong.


[API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Events Endpoint]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#d977b310-e443-4d44-ad73-614883cff0c9 
[API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Events]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#1388f5dc-0ecc-4766-80a1-d7ae835a0c2d

response.name: Mock Start listening to events - ping

query.description: This parameter can be provided more then once.
This parameter can be provided more then once.

request.description:
A (Data) Service Provider can use callbacks on the [Feed Request Endpoint][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Feed Request Endpoint] to detect and receive incoming [feed request messages][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds].

[API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#da1fbe7f-e134-4b94-94be-f1627696b4d5
[API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Feed Request Endpoint]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#253be29b-0315-4c53-9990-960c24e82998

response.name: Mock User Action Message Event - OK
Mock Get user action message - OK

item.description:
NB: Please ignore the contents in this folder

The requests are used to define the behaviour of the Mock Server.

The Qiy Node service runs in a Mock environment, a development environment, the acceptance environment and the production environment. The server urls are:
DTAP environment Server url
Mock - See the url variable in the Postman 'Mock Server' environment -
Dev2 https://dev2-user.testonly.digital-me.nl/user
Acceptance https://user.dolden.net/user
The server url of the Production environment will be given during the entry-transition phase, when your Qiy Trust Based solution will go live. Ensure that the following system settings are configurable to allow for smooth switching between the environments: * server url * Qiy Node Id * Qiy Node private key * Transport password * API key

item.name: Connected to Router Event
item.description:
This event is fired after a [request for a connection][Connections Individual Request connection] and can be [used][Connections Individual Connected to Router Event] to monitor the [creation of a connection][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connections].

item.name: Connected to Router Failed Event
item.description:
This event is fired after a [request for a connection][Connections Individual Request connection] and signals that a [connection][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connections] could not be established.

item.name: Data Reference Failure Event
item.description:
This server-sent event is fired when a [Request][Feeds Relying Party Request for feed] for [feed][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds] fails.

item.name: Data Reference Received-v2 Event
item.description:

item.name: Data Request Fulfilled Event
item.description:
This server-sent event is fired when a [feed][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds] has been accessed succesfully.

item.name: Data Request Failure Event
item.description:
This server-sent event is fired when a [feed][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds] could not be accessed succesfully.

item.name: Data Request Not Forwarded Event
item.description:
This server-sent event is fired when and if a [feed][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds] cannot be accessed.

item.name: Pending Peer Data Reference Event
item.description:

item.name: Unexpected Data Reference Event
item.description:
This server-sent event can be fired when a [feed][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds] is being accessed.

item.name: Persistent Id Event
item.description:
This event can be [used][Connections Individual Persistent Id Event] to monitor [the creation of a connection][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connections].

item.name: Routing Failure Event
item.description:
This event is fired after a [request for a connection][Connections Individual Request connection] and signals that a [connection][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connections] could not be established.

item.name: State Handled Event
item.description:

item.name: User Action Message Event
item.description:
This event is fired by a Qiy Node when it receives a [message][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Messages] that requires interaction with the End User, and can be used by an End User application to detect that a [feed request has been received][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds].

## Example event

```
event: USER_ACTION_MESSAGE data: {
   'type': 'USER_ACTION_MESSAGE',
   'connectionUrl': 'https://dev1-user.testonly.digital-me.nl/user/connections/user/wip_feed_ind/e33b7dcc-a1f1-4195-893d-97698f0e4d8e',
   'extraData': 'https://dev1-user.testonly.digital-me.nl/user/mbox/user/action/wip_feed_ind?amid=4'
}
```

item.name: Qiy Scheme
Qiy Trust Network
Access Provider
item.description:
An Access Provider is an organisation that provides [Service Providers][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider] access to the [Qiy Trust Network][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy Trust Network].

item.name: Application Provider
item.description:
An Application Provider is an organisation that provides software and/or applications to [Qiy Users][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User] that can be used to access the [Qiy Trust Network][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy Trust Network].

The Qiy Trust Network is the operational part of the [Qiy Scheme][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme] which enables its [users][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User] to securely and privately connect and interact.

item.name: Qiy User
Individual
item.description:
An Individual is a [Qiy User][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User] that accesses the [Qiy Trust Network][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy Trust Network] as a natural person.

item.name: Service Provider
Relying Party
item.description:
A Relying Party is a [Service Provider][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider] that uses [services][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Service Catalogue] provided by other [Service Providers][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider].
They can do so using [Feed requests][Feeds Relying Party Request for feed].

item.name: Data Provider
item.description:
A Data Provider is a [Service Provider][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider] that provides personal data services.
They provide data subjects control over personal data using [feeds][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds], see [Service Orchestration][API Basics Documentation End User App Orchestrate].

A [Service Provider][API Basics Documentation Service Provider] is a [Qiy User][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User] that uses the [Qiy Trust Network][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy Trust Network] to provide [services][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Service Catalogue] to [Individuals][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Individual].

item.name: End User App
Setup
item.description:
An End User App can only access the [Qiy Trust Network][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy Trust Network] under the following preconditions:
1. The End User App uses a valid [Access Provider Token][API Basics Authentication].
2. The [End User App correctly authenticates Qiy Node requests][API Basics Authentication].
3. The End User App must allow End Users to use a [new Qiy Node][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Qiy Node] or reuse an existing one.

item.name: Subscribe
item.description:
An [Individual][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Individual] can subscribe to a service as follows:
1. Conclude an subscription agreement (out-of-scope).
2. [Connect with the Service Provider][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connections].

item.name: Orchestrate
item.description:
When an [Individual][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Individual] has subscribed to a Service provided by a [Relying Party][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider Relying Party], the latter may request for a [feed][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds].
The [End User App][API Basics Documentation End User App] can process these requests as follows:
1. [Wait for User Action Message Event][Feeds Wait for User Action Message Event] to receive feed requests.
3. Extract the userActionMessageUrl from the 'extraData'-field of the event and use it to [fetch the user action message][Feeds Get user action message] with possible Data Providers.
4. Extract the feed request containing the possible Data Providers and related actionUrls.
5. Present the options to the End User and capture the result, e.g. the selected Data Providers.
6. [Add the data providers][Feeds Add feed] or [change the data providers][Feeds Set feeds] using the related actionUrls.

After these steps, [feeds will be automatically created and provided to the Relying Party][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds].

An [End User App](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/qiy-node-interface/High-Level%20Architectural%20Overview.md#5-the-application-layer) is a [Qiy Node Client][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client] which enables an [Individual][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Individual] to [subscribe to][API Basics Documentation End User App Subscribe] and [orchestrate][API Basics Documentation End User App Orchestrate] (data) services.

item.name: Setup
Service Catalogue
item.description:
A [Service Provider][API Basics Documentation Service Provider] publishes the (data) service types it supports in his Service Catalogue, which consists of an array of urls for Service Type Descriptions with additional details, for example for the associated [Feed Request Endpoints][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Feed Request Endpoint], see [Get service catalogue][Services Get service catalogue].

A Service Type Description can contain a list of urls for the description of the Operation Types of the service which are used in as value of the protocol-member in [Feed Requests][Feeds Request for feed].
If the Service Type Description does not contain Operation Type Urls, the Service Type Description Url can be used instead.

item.name: State Handled Endpoint
item.description:
This [event callback endpoint][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Event Callback Endpoints] for [State Handled Events][API Basics Events State Handled Event] is a [Technology Service](http://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/archimate3-doc/chap10.html#_Toc489946097) which can be used to  [detect that a connection has been created][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connections] using callbacks.
The address of the endpoint can be defined with [Set event callback endpoints][Nodes Set event callback endpoints].

item.name: Data Reference Received-v2 Endpoint
item.description:
This [event callback endpoint][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Event Callback Endpoints] is a [Technology Service](http://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/archimate3-doc/chap10.html#_Toc489946097) which can be setup and used by a [Relying Party][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider Relying Party] to [obtain new feed id's][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds].

The address of the endpoint can be defined with [Set event callback endpoint][Nodes Set event callback endpoints].

item.name: Service Endpoint
item.description:
A [Data Provider][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider Data Provider] uses this backend endpoint to serve [requests for feed callback requests][Feeds Data Provider Feed Request Callback] and [feed access callback requests][Feeds Data Provider Access feed callback].

The Data Provider provides the uri of the endpoint using [set service catalogue][Services Set service catalogue].

Before a Service Provider can provide services via Qiy he has to make the following preparations:
1. Describe the services and make these descriptions publicly available.
2. Setup a [State Handled Endpoint][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Event Callback Endpoints State Handled Endpoint].
2. (only for Data Providers:) Setup [Service Endpoint(s)][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Service Endpoint].
2. (only for Relying Parties:) Setup [Data Reference Received-v2 Endpoint][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Event Callback Endpoints Data Reference Received-v2 Endpoint].
3. Prepare the Computer systems to correctly produce [authenticated requests][API Basics Authentication].
1. Contact the [Access Provider][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy Trust Network Access Provider] [DigitalMe](https://digital-me.nl/infrastructure/connect-to-the-network/) to whitelist the endpoints and receive a [Qiy Node Credential and an API Key][API Basics Authentication].
2. Configure the computer system for the Qiy Node.
3. [Publish the Service Catalogue with Qiy][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Service Catalogue].

item.name: Qiy Node Credential
Qiy Node Primary Key
item.description:
One element of the Qiy Node Credential is the primary key.

## Python
In Python, the primary key can be created with the package 'cryptography'.
The key can be created and persisted as follows:

```
from cryptography.hazmat.backends import default_backend
from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.rsa import generate_private_key
from cryptography.hazmat.primitives import serialization

private_key = generate_private_key(
                backend=default_backend(),
                public_exponent=65537,
                key_size=2048
                )
           
with open(pem_filename, "wb") as f:
    f.write(private_key.private_bytes(
        encoding=serialization.Encoding.PEM,
        format=serialization.PrivateFormat.TraditionalOpenSSL,
        encryption_algorithm=serialization.NoEncryption())
        )

```

item.name: Qiy Node Public Key
item.description:
In python, the public key can be obtained using the package 'pyOpenSSL'.
Given the pem-file, this goes as follows:

```
import OpenSSL

with open("data/"+target_short_node_id+".pem" , "r") as f:
    buffer = f.read()
private_key = OpenSSL.crypto.load_privatekey(OpenSSL.crypto.FILETYPE_PEM, buffer)
public_key=OpenSSL.crypto.dump_publickey(
    OpenSSL.crypto.FILETYPE_ASN1,
    private_key)
```

A Qiy Node credential consists of:
* A [Qiy Node Id][API Basics Authentication User Authentication]
* An [RSA key pair][API Basics Authentication User Authentication]
* A [Transport Password][API Basics Authentication Password Header Parameter]

A Qiy Node is an access point for the [Qiy Trust Network][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy Trust Network] and can be maintained and used with [node calls][Nodes].
Qiy Nodes are provided by [DigitalMe](https://digital-me.nl) to [Service Providers][API Basics Documentation Service Provider] on [registration][API Basics Registration]. [End User Apps][API Basics Documentation End User App] can create Qiy Nodes by generating a [Qiy Node credential][API Basics Authentication] and [request the creation of a Qiy Node][Nodes Request creation of Qiy Node] as described in [section 3.1 Create Qiy Node](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#31-create-qiy-node) of the [DigitalMe Qiy Node specification](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#1-introduction).

item.name: Connections
item.description:
[Individuals][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Individual] can connect and interact with other Individuals and [Service Providers][API Basics Documentation Service Provider] using connections between the related [Qiy Nodes][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Qiy Node].

Connections can be created between an invitor and an invitee using [Connect Tokens][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connect Tokens] as follows:
1. The invitor [requests][Connections Request connect token] or [creates][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connect Tokens Create Connect Token] and [registers][Connections Register connect token] a Connect Token.
2. The invitor invites the invitee to connect with the Connect Token out-of-band.
3. The invitee [requests a connection using the connect token][Connections Request connection].
4. The invitor receives a [State Handled Callback][Connections State Handled Callback] notifying that the connect token has been used to create a connection.
5. The invitee receives a [State Handled Event][Connections State Handled Event] notifying that the connection has been established.

item.name: Connect Tokens
Create Connect Token
item.description:
A Connect Token is a json-object with three members which can be created as follows:
* id: This is a label and can be any string.
* target: The format of this member is returned in the "target-template"-member of the response of [Get endpoint addresses][Nodes Get endpoint addresses], where '~id~' should be a uuid.
* tmpSecret: This member is a string: an array of 16 random bytes which is base64-encoded.

In Java the tmpSecret can be generated as follows:
```
SecureRandom RANDOM = new SecureRandom();
byte[] tmpSecret = new byte[16];
RANDOM.nextBytes(tmpSecret);
String tmpSecretString = Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(tmpSecret);
```

item.name: Online Connect Tokens
item.description:
An Online Connect Token is a connect token that has been created by the [Qiy Trust Network][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy Trust Network] when executing [Request Connect Token][Connections Request connect token].

item.name: Offline Connect Tokens
item.description:
An Offline Connect Token is a Connect Token that has been [created][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connect Tokens Create Connect Token] by a Qiy Node Client and registered later using [Register connect token][Connections Register connect token].

item.name: On-Connected Actions
item.description: An On-Connected Actions is an action such as the execution of a http-request that can be defined for a Connect Token and that is executed whenever the token has been used to create a connection.

A Connect Token can be used to create [connections][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connections] between [Qiy Users][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User], for example an [Individual][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Individual] and a [Service Provider][API Basics Documentation Service Provider].
The connect token may be [created][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connect Tokens Create Connect Token] by either of the two, but when connecting to a Service Provider it must always be [registered][Connections Register connect token] or otherwise [requested][Connections Request connect token] by the [Service Provider][API Basics Documentation Service Provider].

item.name: Feeds
item.description:
Feeds can be used by a [Relying Party][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider Relying Party] to access personal data (consume subscribed services) of an [individual][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Individual] from (provided by) a [Data Provider][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider Data Provider].

## Relying Party
A Relying Party (RP) can do so as follows:
1. The RP requests an Individual for a feed using a [request for feed][Feeds Relying Party Request for feed].
0. The RP receives a [callback][Feeds Relying Party Data Reference Received-v2 Callback] with (or [polls for][Feeds Relying Party List feed ids]) a feed id.
1. The RP uses the feed id in a [feed access][Feeds Relying Party Access feed]-request to acquire the data (issue a service operation request).


## End User App
The feed-flow of an End User App is described [here][API Basics Documentation End User App Orchestrate].

[API Basics Documentation End User App Orchestrate]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#9af1e7a2-d43e-4bc3-8f58-860bb85d6052 


## Data Provider
The feed-flow for a Data Provider (DP) is as follows:
1. The DP sets up and uses a [Service Endpoint][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Service Endpoint] to receive and process [requests for feeds][Feeds Data Provider Feed Request Callback] and return feed id's.
2. The DP sets up and uses the same [Service Endpoint][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Service Endpoint] to receive and process [feed access requests][Feeds Data Provider Access feed callback].

item.name: Events
item.description:
A Qiy Node supports a number of events.
The Qiy Client can receive the events using a [Server-Sent Events](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Server-sent_events)-listener, see [Start listening to events][Nodes Start listening to events], or using [callbacks][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Event Callback Endpoints].

A Qiy Node Client is any [Application Service](http://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/archimate3-doc/chap09.html#_Toc489946075) that accesses a Qiy Node.
This section addresses topics that are relevant for developers of both [End User Apps][API Basics Documentation End User App] and computer systems of [Service Providers][API Basics Documentation Service Provider].

request.description:
GET /api can be used to get the [api version][API Basics Versions] and the current address of the [Node Create Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Node Create Endpoint].

NB: App Authentication is OPTIONAL in this version, but will be MANDATORY in v1.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.value: Cache-Control, Pragma, Origin, Authorization, Content-Type, X-Requested-With, Set-Cookie, Cookie, Accept, password
header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Headers
header.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Access-Control-Expose-Headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

header.name: tracker
header.description: Custom header

header.value: Mock Request creation of Qiy Node - OK

request.description:
This [Node Create Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Node Create Endpoint]-call can be used to [request the creation of a Qiy Node][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Qiy Node].

A 201-Created will be returned when the Qiy Node has been created.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.value: Cache-Control, Pragma, Origin, Authorization, Content-Type, X-Requested-With, Set-Cookie, Cookie, Accept, password
header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Headers
header.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Access-Control-Expose-Headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

header.name: tracker
header.description: Custom header

request.description:
This [Event Callbacks Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Event Callbacks Endpoint]-request can be used to define the addresses of the [event callback endpoints][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Event Callback Endpoints].

exec: // Use '//Dynamic Endpoint Addresses/Get Api' to the eventsEndpointUrl.

header.value: Mock Start listening to events - ping

request.description:
This [Events Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Events Endpoint]-call can be used to start listening to [Qiy Node events][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Events].

It starts a long-living session with a heartbeat to keep the response open. 
Every 10 seconds a 'ping' comment will be sent. If this is not received for more than that time, something has gone wrong.

This [Connect Token Create Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Connect Token Create Endpoint]-call can be used to [request a connect token][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connect Tokens]: a json object with the members 'identifier', 'tmpSecret' and 'target'. 
When the call was succesfull, a 200-OK will be returned with the Connect Token Url in the Location header of the response.

This [Connect Token Create Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Connect Token Create Endpoint]-call registers a [connect token][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connect Tokens]: a json object with the members 'identifier', 'tmpSecret' and 'target'. The call returns the Connect Token Url in the Location header of the response.

request.description:
This callback on the [State Handled Callback Endpoint][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints State Handled Endpoint] can be used to [detect a new connection][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connections].

This asynchronous [Connection Create Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Connection Create Endpoint]-call can be used to [request a connection][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connections] using a [Connect Token][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connect Tokens]: a json object with the members 'identifier', 'tmpSecret' and 'target'.

The creation of the connection can be followed using events, for details see [/API Basics/Documentation/Qiy Node Client/Connections][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connections]: 

If and when the connection has been established, at least two [State Handled Events][API Basics Events State Handled Event] will be fired; one for the Qiy Node Client that requested the connection and one for the Qiy Node Client that requested or registered the Connect Token. The event will also be fired for any other Qiy Node Client that is connected to one of the involved Qiy Nodes. Also, two [State Handled Callbacks][Connections Relying Party/Data Provider State Handled Callback] will be fired for the Qiy Nodes, but only if the State Handled Callback Endpoint has been set, see [Set event callback endpoints][Nodes Set event callback endpoints].

Alternatively, the [list of connections can be gotten](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#09bc508a-257a-4a33-9252-542868baebe3). 
Here a connection should be present with the 'activeFrom' property should have the value of the current time (in milliseconds from the epoch), 'pid' should be a Base 64 encoded value, 'state' should be 'connected'.

header.value: Mock Connected to Router Event - OK

request.description:
The [Connected to Router Event][API Basics Events Connected to Router Event] can be used to monitor the [creation of a connection][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Connections].

request.description:
This [Mailbox Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Mailbox Endpoint]-call can be used to send a [message][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Messages] over a connection with another Qiy User.

request.description:
A [Relying Party][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider Relying Party] uses this [Connection Feeds Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Connection Feeds Endpoint]-call to request for a [feed][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds].

Optionally, a [Feed Request Callback](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#5f31a320-78d9-469b-b577-b45f79199bdd) body parameter can be included in the 'input'-member of the body json object as a base64-encoded byte array.

When successfull this will end in a [Data Reference Received Event-v2][API Basics Events Data Reference Received Event-v2].
Failure will be either a HTTP error status code or a [Data Reference Failure Event][API Basics Events Data Reference Failure].

A [Relying Party][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider Relying Party] can use this [Data Reference Received-v2][API Basics Events Data Reference Received-v2 Event]-callback on the [Data Reference Received-v2 Endpoint][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Event Callback Endpoints Data Reference Received-v2 Endpoint] to [receive new feed id's][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds].

A Relying Party uses this [Feeds Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Feeds Endpoint]-call to access a single [feed][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds].

The body may include operation request parameters encoded as a base-64 encoded byte array as described in the [Qiy Scheme change proposal on free parameters](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/free-parameters/end-to-end%20encryption/CP%20End-to-End%20Encryption%20-%20Review%20Guide.md).

[Feeds Data Provider Access feed callback]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#58021703-b84e-43ec-8fe8-0408503c42d8

[Feeds Individual User Action Message Event]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#f693e165-1484-4f72-8e1f-9dff7ab13b25
[Feeds Individual Get user action message]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#122a0a4b-f6fc-4180-b970-d07db11667c9
[Feeds Individual Set feed]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#00faf2fd-c7c7-4d5d-b4d8-19f7a8cc55b1
[Feeds Individual Add feed]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#d628b6d5-057f-4ce9-9a01-2c13e785cda0
[Getting help]: https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/?version=latest#9acb0133-e012-4f49-a1e9-51283b8402c9

A Relying Party can use this [Feeds Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses References Endpoint]-call to access one or more [feeds][API Basics Documentation Qiy Node Client Feeds].

The json body may include 'input'-members for operation request parameters encoded as a base-64 encoded byte array as described in the [Qiy Scheme change proposal on free parameters](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/free-parameters/end-to-end%20encryption/CP%20End-to-End%20Encryption%20-%20Review%20Guide.md).

When successfull, the data is returned in the response of the body in a format as this:

{
	"{{feed_id1}}": {
		"content-type": "application/xml",
		"output": "<json member with base-64 encrypted byte array>"
	},
	"{{feed_id2}}": {
		"content-type": "application/json",
		"output": "<json member with base-64 encrypted byte array>"
	}
}

query.description: This parameter can be provided more then once.

request.description:
This [Feeds Endpoint][API Basics Dynamic Endpoint Addresses Feeds Endpoint]-request can be used to list the feed's with feed details of a Qiy Node or a connection for all or a set of protocols (operation types).

query.description: This parameter can be provided more then once.

request.description:
A [Data Provider][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Service Provider Data Provider] receives this [Service Endpoint][API Basics Documentation Service Provider Setup Endpoints Service Endpoint]-callback when an [Individual][API Basics Documentation Qiy Scheme Qiy User Individual] has set him as the [source of a feed][Feeds Individual Set feed].

header.value: Mock User Action Message Event - OK

request.description:
An End User App can use the [User Action Message Event][API Basics Events User Action Message Event] to detect the [receipt of a feed request][API Basics Documentation End User App Orchestrate].
